intro: Ligustrum ibota var. suave, commonly known as the sweet privet, is a shrub native to parts of Southeast Asia. It features small, opposite, oval-shaped leaves that are typically a glossy green on top and lighter in color underneath. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers in clusters during the spring, which are followed by dark blue berries. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various soil conditions. However, it can become invasive in some regions if not properly managed.
